heading: burp for life
subheading: mammals started becoming dominant on earth about 55 million years ago, and according to some researchers, they have a big belch of methane gas to thank for it. scientists say they've found strong evidence of a huge release of the gas from the deep ocean that coincided with a period of global warming, which was good for mammals and bad for other life forms. if they can confirm all this, they think it will help us understand modern global warming. meanwhile, next time somebody burps up a bit of burrito, thank him.
author: wired staff
